bug.short_desc: [prov] [ui] Investigate smarter label provides in Available/installed features list to improve workflow

long_desc.thetext:
(spun out as separate issue from bug #203009)
Currently the Available/Installed features lists show the name/version/size info, and a group of buttons at the right lets you act on them.
Something interesting to explore (more like Firefox) would be multi-line label providers. You click on an IU and the label provider grows to show more info, possibly including a button that lets you install it.
It would also be nice to include an icon for each IU.
This is something to explore once all the basic function is working.

From bug #229364, Martin suggests
>Use colors to make additional information like paths and URLs less dominant

This is not really an issue anymore now that we've integrated the available software view into the install wizard itself. There's no need to push an "Install" button because you are already inside the install wizard. There are no buttons on the right...the user presses next/finish to complete the task.
